item.title: Pump Low Pressure Indication Systems – Engine Driven Pump (EDP) Pressure Switches

numlitem.para: Associated demand pump AUTO function is considered inoperative,
Associated system pressure indication is verified to be operative,
Associated pump is operative before each departure, and
Associated demand pump indication system is operative.

The AUTO position of the respective Demand Pump must be considered inoperative. Therefore, the respective Demand Pump selector for the No. 1 or No. 4 system (if either is the affected system) must be selected ON for departure and arrival.
If requested, Confirm affected pump(s) operation after flight with maintenance, prior to shutdown.
To satisfy repetitive inspection requirement, enter comment in Logbook after check.

placard.para: Placard the affected EDP Pressure switch: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Placard the associated Demand Pump Selector AUTO Position: "AUTO INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Check affected pump operation as follows:

caution.para: DO NOT OPERATE PUMPS FOR MORE THAN 15 MINUTES WITHOUT MINIMUM QUANTITIES IN FUEL TANKS DUE TO POSSIBLE PUMP OVERHEAT.

numlitem.para: With affected engine running, perform check below. This check could also be performed by the flight crew prior to shutting down engines on previous flight, or just prior to departure.
Ensure that personnel are clear of flight controls.
Verify system hydraulic pressure display on EICAS must read between 2800-3200 psig.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.
